Reviews.Title: These cameras are great! Here's some help setting them up.
Reviews.Author: jammendolia
Reviews.Content: I've read the negative reviews, and let me just say that I suspect the people writing them were just a little confused about how to set up and operate these cameras. I agree that the directions are terrible! (I mean really bad) but if you've got any level of technical know-how, you wont have any trouble figuring these things out.Here's some help getting them set up:Note: If you're configuring multiple cameras, I recommend you do the configuration one camera at a time. Leave additional cameras unplugged to prevent any confusion while obtaining settings information.First, you can't just plug the camera in and expect it to work if you have a wireless network that requires a passkey to connect. (You do protect your network, don't you?!) In fact, I thinkg the wireless settings are disabled by default anyway. So, to get on the network, connect the camera to your wireless router using the provided network cable. This way it can get on the network without needing a password (This is exactly what they say to do in step one in the user's manual).Next, insert the CD, and it should auto-run - Oh, I guess I should point out that this part of the instructions are for Windows based PCs. If you're running mac/*nux, then I suggest you borrow a windows laptop or run a virtual windows install to get this done. (Too bad they didn't supply a native app). If you're technical enough though, I'm sure you can figure out how to find your cam on the network. If so, then you wont even need to run the CD. (Hint: look at your router's DHCP client list.)Assuming you are on Windows; When the EasyN window appears, click on "Search IP Camera". On the "Select Mode" screen, click the "Advance Mode" button. In the "Equipments" box, you should see a list, and the camera should be in it.  Should be Series F, name IPCAM1, IP ###.###.###.###. single click this line in the list to select that camera. Now in the right hand side, you should see detailed info. What you're concerned with now is the HTTP Port #. Write down the IP Address and HTTP Port# of the camera, and you'll also want to write down the "sunet mask", "gateway", and "primary DNS" values from the top left pane of this window. You'll need them later when setting up the network settings for the camera.Once you know the camera's details, you can close this program.Next, open your web browser and in the address bar put  [...]  where ###.###.###.### is the IP address for the camera and PP is the HTTP Port that you found above. It should look something like:  [...] (but the numbers may be different for you).Now you should get a login prompt. The default login is "admin" (no quotes), and there is no password. Once you log in, you'll see a menu.The option you choose here depends on which browser you're using.  If you are using Internet Explorer, use the ActiveX mode (the top one in the list). This one is the most full featured (i.e. will let you control the camera, and hear/send audio from/to the camera). If you're not using Internet Explorer, select the second option "Server Push Mode". This mode still allows you to control the camera, but doesn't support audio. (I wish they had used a java or flash viewer. I hate IE, and refuse to use it. But the IE version is the only one that supports the extended features.)Regardless of which one you selected, you should now see the camera viewer with controls at the right. You'll want to click the "options" icon (looks like a gear) at the bottom of the controls.Once in the "EasyN IP Camera Options" screen, there is a menu on the left. Just follow along:First, I set my own admin username and password.  Do this from the "Users Settings" menu. I highly recommend you change the user name and password. Just click into the box that currently says "admin" and change it to something else that you'll remember. Then click into the Password field to the right, and enter a password you'll remember. Make sure group still says "Administrator". Then click the "Set" button at the bottom.  You'll be prompted to log in again. Use the username and password you just set.  The device will reboot. Just be patient because once it's finished, you'll be back on the device status page.Next, I turned off the DDNS feature they offer. I don't want just anyone being able to connect to my cameras from outside. I know they're password protected, but I was able to find a way to capture an image without a password. So I suggest everyone turn this feature off. This can be done on the "DDNS Service Settings" menu. select "none" in the "DDNS Service" dropdown then click "Set". Again, device may reboot.  Just be patient.Next, I set up my network configuration.Go to the "Basic Network Settings" menu, I recommend you uncheck the "Obtain IP from DHCP Server", then set the IP Address and other details according to your network config. In my environment, My camera IP was 192.168.1.12. But I decided to set a fixed address for each camera so they'd never change. I wanted to have my cameras start at 192.168.1.240 and each additional camera, I would set up with that same address + 1 (i.e. 192.168.1.241 then 192.168.1.242, etc.) So,  I unchecked the "Obtain IP from DHCP server", then in the "IP Address" box, I put "192.168.1.240" (no quotes).One important thing to note. when you select an IP address for your camera, be sure you only change the last number. The first 3 numbers should stay the same (i.e. 192.168.1.xxx, only change the xxx part). Also, be sure you don't set the value to 0(zero) or a number higher than 254. And finally, make sure you don't set it to the same value as your computer, or the gateway. I recommend picking a value well above the DHCP range defined in your wireless router's configuration. You can get that info from your wireless router's admin page. (use google or the manual for help if you're not sure how to find it.)Next, in the "Subnet Mask" box, I put "255.255.255.0" (Yours is probably the same). In the "Gateway" box, enter the value for Gateway that you wrote down earlier. In the "DNS Server" box you'll enter whatever value you wrote down for "Primary DNS" earlier. And finally, in the "Http Port" box, you can put any numeric value you want here, but I recommend you just leave it set to "81". Then click the "Set" button.Ok, now your camera is going to reboot. But this time, you will not automatically end up back in the menu (the IP address is now going to be whatever you set it to above). So, you will need to change the location in the browser to [...] where ###.###.###.### is the IP address you set above, and PP is the port you set. (note. you may need to wait 20 seconds or so for the camera to reboot before you can access it again). You will be asked to log in again. Use the new login info you set up above. After that, you should be back on the main menu screen. Go into the ActiveX or Server Push mode screen, and click the gear icon again.Now to get wireless working.You should be back on the "EasyN IP Camera Options" screen. If not, get back to it, then Click the "Wireless Lan Settings" option in the left menu.Click "Scan". You should see a list of available access points appear. You'll want to select yours from the list. Make sure the "Use Wireless Lan" box is checked. When you selected your access point, it should have pre-filled the remaining values except "Share Key".Ok, I dont know if it auto selects the correct "Encryption" option, and selecting the correct one can be a little tricky if you dont know how your wireless router is set up. You can find this out by looking at your router's configuration screen, but most likely, it'll be one of the WPA or WPA2 options. I'm not going to talk you through finding this info though. For that, search google, or refer to your router's manual (Hint: you'll need to look at the wireless security settings to get the right encryption type).Once you know the correct Encryption type, select it from the dropdown, then enter your wireless password into the "Share Key" box. Once done, click "Set".The camera should reboot again. At this point, you should unplug the network cable from the back of the camera. It should now connect wirelessly.You'll know it worked if you can get to it in your browser. Again, give it 20 seconds or so before you give up trying. If it still doesnt connect, plug the cable back, give it a few more seconds, then refresh the page, and check your settings. (You may not have the correct Encryption type set or the wrong Share Key). Keep trying. You will find the right value. just repeat the wireless setup using different values for encryption type. Assuming you are entering the correct share key (case probably matters), one of them should work.At this point, I assume you have wireless working.If you want to be able to access the camera from the internet, you'll need to set up a port forward on your router. Again, refer to your router's manual, or google for how to do it (there are a plethora of online tutorials for every router model ever made).On mine, I set up external port 801 -> 192.168.1.240:81 and because I have more than one camera, I also set up external port 802 -> 192.168.1.241:81.  this way I can just go to [...] (or:802) to view each camera. I recommend [...] for dynamic DNS. Yes the camera does support ddns, but I highly recommend you not use it because anyone who is familiar with their setup could potentially access your camera. Instead, get a freedns.afraid.org address, and set up your main computer to keep the address updated with the correct external IP. (again, google is your friend here. there are plenty of tutorials around for doing this)Once you have your port forwards in place, and you have verified you can get to the cameras from outside, the next step is probably a mobile device viewer.  The included viewer is junk. I repeat JUNK!  However, I came across an application for iOS that supports these cameras quite well! (including listening to the audio stream). It's called "uNetCams" ([...]) . It's not free, but well worth the money! As for Android, there are some viewers out there, and I suspect they work fine, but I haven't tested them.One final note:  If you are going to be accessing the cameras from outside, I suggest you add an additional user in the "Users Settings" section of the options window. You can enter up to 7 additional users, and assign each one its own security level. Just add a second user with its own password, and give it the "Viewer" permission. Then use that user info when configuring the mobile viewer. This way, even if someone was able to "sniff" your settings, they wouldn't have administrative access to you camera.Hope this writeup helps somebody!  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Some tips for setup
Reviews.Author: avmaniac
Reviews.Content: It's easy to set up for LAN access. Almost plug and play. It took me a few hours to figure out how to set it up for internet access though.Here are some tips.1. Be sure to set up your router for port forwarding. Usually from port 80(external) to 81(internal).2. The URL is ????.dns.ipcam.hk instead of ????.ipcam.hk as described in the set up software and outside of the box.3. The default username/password to access the URL is admin/. The other password on the box is for DDNS.The manual sucks. But once you get beyond the setup, the quality of the cam is great. No need for me to say more. Just get one... Read more

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, with poor Iphone/ipad software
Reviews.Author: N. L. Lambert "N. Lambert"
Reviews.Content: The camera has excellent quality and the pan features make it a high value for the dollar.  I am disappointed in the iphone/ipad software. It does't seem to get the camera to load at all.  I have tried it both with 3G and with a local wifi connection and the software still doesn't work. I don't have any problems viewing security cameras through commercial services on my iphone or ipad.The documentation isn't very clear either.  I took my relatively advanced level of networking skills to get the camera to work over the internet.  They had a domain that they use, that is supposed to work, but I could not get it to work.  I had to manually configure a port through the router's firewall, and finally guess at the IP address of the camera to work. Once I did that, it worked very well over the internet. IE9 version of the software the comes with it likes to crash, and the software for the other web browsers tend to be sluggish, especally  when trying to panBottom line is this is an excellent camera if you are looking to use it on a PC inside the same network it is on. If that is how you use the camera, it is easy to use.  If you are planning on using it on a PC over the internet, it will be a test of your networking skills the you may enjoy. I don't know if I enjoyed the test, but I did enjoy passing the test.  If you are planning on viewing it on your iphone or ipad, this is not the camera for you.I give the software 1.5 stars, but the camera is a solid 5 star.  If they would fix the software this would be a first class product at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Product - Fully Featured
Reviews.Author: Tony Patti
Reviews.Content: I bought this on a whim.  I was going out of town and wanted a camera where I could keep an eye on my house while I was gone.  Initial setup was a little sketchy.  I was on a wireless laptop and I had the camera wired into the router.  Apparently the camera doesn't just get an address from DHCP like any normal host.  It has a pre-configured IP address.  Luckily the setup software has a setting where you can just directly attach the camera to the PC via ethernet.  Once I did that, the software discovered the device.  I was able to give the camera an IP address for my network and give it the wireless settings it needed to connect to the WIFI.Then the real fun started.  So you can view live video, pan, tilt and control the video settings but you can also do the following...-Configure the camera to activate on motion and send pictures in an email.  (You can use gmail for free)-Set a schedule for the motion alarmThese are very important to me because if someone breaks in and sees the camera it should have enough time to snap some pics and send them to me before they smash or unplug the camera.Overall I'm completely satisfied with the camera's functions.  I was looking at Cisco units for around $250 that aren't as feature-rich as this unit.  I'm thinking about buying a couple more because you can view multiple feeds through one web interface.EDIT:  Initially my camera's green light would flash constantly.  I found how to disable that.Go to settings>PTZ Settings> and set Indicator Display Mode to "Been Extinguished"

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mewers
Reviews.Content: I've only had it a few days, and so far this camera is amazing.  It was really easy to set up on the network, even the WIFI.The only trouble i had was when it asked me for the admin password, i thought it wanted me to set one.. when it really wanted me to type in the default admin password.. which is blank. (which it didn't alert a wrong password, it just wouldn't change the gateway/ip settings... so it made me read the manual)The image quality is good, and the pan/tilt is really good also... and it seems to be at least a little durable, as when I first got it, before installing it, i was playing around with my cat.. and he knocked it a few feet to the ground, and it was fine.Given this is the first IP Camera i have purchased, I couldn't imagine wanting any more out of your camera except for being weather proof.

Reviews.Title: Some tips for setup Wireless once done Great Unit!!!
Reviews.Author: Mookie6870
Reviews.Content: I had IPCam up in 15 min.  The booklet nor the CD software tells you to connect cam to your local network with a wire on a 192.168.1.x network.  I notice on the box the box the IPCam had a 192.168.1.126 IP which would cause a problem of my network as it was set to 10.0.0.x.  Once I set my laptop to the 192.168.1.2 I was able to configure the IPCam to my network with a static IP of 10.0.0.126.Now after configuring the IPCam to your network you can log into the Cam to setup the wireless configuration which is not in the book clearly.After you are able to log into the IPCam, look for the wireless section and their should be a button to search for network.  Your network and others should pop up.  Choose yours network name and enter your security key or paraphrase.Once this is done the IPcam will reboot and take up to 5 min to restart then you should be able to connect wirelessly and control it.I received my unit March 31, 2012 I must say I think the unit on is great for the price!  Like i said I had mine up in 15 min and it has not dropped a connection so far. I connect to it directly and using Blue Iris which I am considering also.If you are going to view from the internet; you need to make sure you configure you Port Forwarding setting in your router or you will not be able to view from the Internet.I view from my BlackBerry Torch, Iphone, Laptop, and my wife uses her Andriod phone and laptop.Also, I put the IPcam on a battery Backup so it will not drop the connection if the power goes out.  I will still be recording at all times.  Good LuckI think for the price you can't wrong with this product.

Reviews.Title: Good Luck! You are on your own.....
Reviews.Author: MartyDacat
Reviews.Content: Spent hours and hours and hours trying to get this to work. The best I could do is a direct (wired) connection to the home network. The video image, as well as the pan/tilt worked well.....the only reason it got two stars instead of one. The wireless did not work. Connecting to an android phone (why I purchased the camera) was impossible. The instructions are great....if you are Chinese. The english interpretation is spastic. Don't bother trying to contact the manufacturer/distributor.....three emails were never answered. Needless to say, its going back.A little help from the manufacturer/distributor could make this a winner...but for now....forget it.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE INSTRUCTIONS
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera and spend 5 hrs setting it up.  Thank god for google!  If you are not tech savy you better know someone who is because the instructions included are horrible.

Reviews.Title: EasyN Camera name says it all
Reviews.Author: rustyshackleford
Reviews.Content: Just received my EasyN camera. I read the reviews that say its difficult to set up. I don't know where the got that from.Here's what I did to set up.1.unbox camera, 2. Plugged power to camera, 3. Plugged Cat5 from camera to router, 4. Used iphone to scan QR code off of box or bottom of camera and install EasyN FS App and search for camera...and poof there it is.  Took me 2 minutes of my time.  I can control camera from my iphone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and get working
Reviews.Author: D.J. Jared
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and get working if you have knowledge about IP addresses and port forwarding.  Make sure your router and firewall allow port forwarding.

Reviews.Title: Beware of warranty
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:After 3 months of rock-solid stable and reliable operation, my EasyN camera is now spontaneously rebooting every hour.  Seller CameraTec has said they offer a 1-year warranty (though you're stuck with shipping charges), but I wouldn't assume all sellers here will do the same.  The company (EasyN) has NO US PRESENCE, so they don't offer or honor any warranties for products sold in this country.The only real upgrade from these types of cameras is going with one that does H.264 video compression (instead of just MJPEG) and/or that can act as a DVR, recording up to 2-weeks of video to an internal micro SD card slot, such as the Esky 5900.  Those also have switchable IR filters for more-accurate color, and the IR lights can be shut-off in the settings.  But there are lots of negative reports about MJPEG performance being only 1FPS, and with the price being nearly double, I opted for this camera instead.  Or you can go with one of THESE if you just want the SD DVR function, without networking or pan/tilt, for 20% less than this camera.This camera comes with a much wider-angle lens than my previous IP camera, which is the better choice in most scenarios, and I'm happier to have a larger view.  However, this unit's picture quality is just slightly poorer all-around, and noticeably less sensitive in the dark.Works reliably with Firefox, tinycam on Android (video and audio send/receive), and recording the MJPEG stream with my custom scripts.  The ability to limit maximum frame rate was absent in older firmware, and is an absolutely great feature that saves bandwidth and delivers more consistent timing.  This one isn't crashing at all, after running (and recording) for days, unlike my previous camera that cost twice as much, which would suddenly reset itself every few hours (and a better power supply didn't help).To initially set this camera up, just plug it into your network and power it up.  It will grab an IP address from the DHCP server.  Use a port-scanner (like nmap) to quickly scan your network for just port 81.  Type the IP address of the camera, with ":81" on the end of it, in your web brower address bar.  Default user/password is "admin" and (blank) "".  When creating user accounts, limit the password to 8 characters, an old http-auth issue.  Disable DHCP and type a static IP address.  Click "scan" button a few times until it picks up your WiFi, then select it, chose the encryption and type in your key, then click "set" and unplug the ethernet cable while rebooting, and it should be reachable on WiFi, and you're good to go.  To access it outside of your network, you need to open and forward a port on your router/nat/firewall, and the procedure to do that varies greatly from one manufacturer to the next.If you'd like more control than the web interface gives you, search the web for "ip camera cgi pdf".  There are more settings available than you know.  Most notably, you can set pan/tilt speeds 10X slower, you can set periodic horizontal and/or vertical patrols every few minutes.  etc.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: cashxx "cashxx"
Reviews.Content: I love these cams for the price!  I bought 3 of them for around the house and have a DVR setup to record whats going on.  I'd love to get two outdoor versions at some point!  These are easy to setup if you have a little knowledge of basic networking. If your expecting to take one out of the box and it walk you through how to set it up then move along or hire someone to set them up for you.The only problem I have with these EasyN cams and that goes for Foscam, Wansview, etc is you need Internet Explorer to do somethings like talk and hear what is going on because it uses ActiveX. This isn't the 90's anymore and should be using HTML5 now and get rid of the proprietary crap!  The last camera I got was buggy and wouldn't take settings, after a reset then it started to work ok then.  Still buggy firmware, but for the price, so far they have been great cams and look as good as TRENDnet cams that cost triple!

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: ACKboy
Reviews.Content: Works so far but can't get my router to let me view it when I'm away from home.  Also I'm gonna have to learn how to set up the e-mail and stuff but when you stop learning you start dieing right.?  "YouTube It", that's what I always say.  Only reason for the four star's is I don't know if the other stuff works, but I can view everything at home on my laptop and my IPhone.  When I wake up to someone ringing the doorbell I can pick up my phone and move the camera to see who's waking me up so early in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: ssrprincess
Reviews.Content: It works well and it a great product, but it was really hard to set up with very unclear instructions.  I don't believe it is the sellers fault that it was hard to set up though it was just the product.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: cuchodechile
Reviews.Content: It's has an acceptable image quality and good performace, very easy to install. I had liked a alternative power supply like batteries.

Reviews.Title: Did not perform to specifications
Reviews.Author: Larry Fitch
Reviews.Content: Device would not detect any wireless SSID broadcast, therefore it was impossible to go wireless with my network or any network.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what we need it to...
Reviews.Author: K. Chevitanondr
Reviews.Content: We got this to use as a baby monitor..not trusting the ones marketed for that purpose.  (Anyone with the receiver for those type can see your kid as long as they are within range.)  We initially got the IZON and it was horrible.  You cannot see unless there is full light in the room and there is a significant delay.  With the EasyN we can see the baby clearly enough to actually see her breathing.Pros.Clear picture even in the dark2 way audio available though we don't use itEasy set up (We had none of the problems described in other reviews.)Preset camera angles,click on them like channels and the camera will move to show you that view.Moves very quietlyCons.The power went out and it apparently knocked the camera out entirely and we had to do a complete reset...only took 20 mins tops but we had to wait a night when we realized it so we wouldn't wake the baby taking it down.This is well worth the money and is very much cheaper than items sold specifically as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Not the same as Foscam 8918w
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I am sure I am not the only one you purchased this unit thinking it was just the same as a Foscam IP camera. Well it is not. It does work, but the wireless range is not as good as the Foscam 8918w I have. Also you cannot turn off the IR LEDs. Since I was setting up to view out of inside windows the reflection from the IR LEDs make the display at night unusable. Daytime viewing and the color display are good. The one good point is they have very good software, better than Foscam, but the unit itself is lacking. for a savings of only $14 I'll buy a Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine BUT impossible to set up remote internet access. I bought this camera for that reaon only and spent a whole day trying to setup it up. It still does not work.I have tried several solutions in the product's reviews..unsuccesfully..worst ever purchase..

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but no WiFi
Reviews.Author: New Englander - Route 95
Reviews.Content: Setting up this camera has really been a handful.  After 3 days (about 90 minutes per day) I finally have it working while it is attached by ethernet cable to my router but I can't get it to work as a wireless camera.  I am not sending it back because I am sure that sooner or later I will figure it out, plus my setup allows me to keep the ethernet cable plugged in for now.  The camera itself provides very clear video and the spin radiuses are terrific.  I really like being able to monitor my house from anywhere.  The manual is fairly worthless, and the Instruction Video's voice-over is downright scarey.... a heavily accented English (with imperfect grammer) that seems too silly to be real.  If I finally figure out the WiFi part then I will upgrade this to three stars but right now it is a solid two stars.  One last note, any computer that you plan to access your camera from (that is running Internet Explorer) will require you to download an ActiveX program first - many Computer Owners are sqeemish about allowing anyone to load an ActiveX program on ther systems (my employer said "no").Feb 14th 2012: I did say that I would update this review when I got the wifi part to work.  Thanks to a fellow-camera-user who posted a youtube video [...] my camera is now functioning as a wifi device and I really enjoy it.  It definitely was a hassle to get it working but it was also an education into how these cameras (or any wifi device) need the various protocols set in order to work.  I now consider this a 3 or 4 star camera.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy (minus one star from stars)
Reviews.Author: D. FOX "chiefdanfox"
Reviews.Content: Win 7 64Linksys router with tomatoEasyN f-M166Tech level: Moderate, sucessfully got another IP camera to work, I build my own computers, light programming skills, moderate network skills.I have never been able to get this to work.  This is a time vampire.  Set my router to port forwarding, per the instructions, (skype works, btw) this camera never shows up in the "search" sw.  Half the time the search punches up a messae in Chinese, and my only option is to hit what I think is the Chinese version of "OK" to get the pop up to go away.  Waste of time, waste of money.  - one star from above rating!

Reviews.Title: how do i return these
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Tryon
Reviews.Content: great camera !!! tilt and pan great !!!  the software sucks i can't get it to talk to my computer want to return these

Reviews.Title: Foscam compatible.
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Foscam compatible. Wireless setup is difficult but it does work, although the wireless is really more of a gimmick than anything else. You still need to run power to the device, so the best option is powering it over ethernet and avoiding all the wireless setup issues all together.

Reviews.Title: unable to get camera to work
Reviews.Author: BILLY
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, after attempting for several hours to install camera, I was unsuccessful and returned camera.  Instructions are very limited and there is no customer support by phone.

Reviews.Title: Good value, but with some serious caveats
Reviews.Author: D. Pruett
Reviews.Content: Once you have this camera up and going, it does an excellent job. It's got good picture quality, good night vision, works wirelessly, etc.BUT... getting it up and going is will be a nightmare if you are not technically inclined.I consider myself pretty technically savvy and I still found it somewhat challenging.  The included instructions are essentially useless.  Instead, search here for the review by jammendolia which contains step-by-step information for getting this camera set up. Without it, I would probably would have sent this back and gotten a refund.That being said, even the instructions by jammendolla aren't fool proof. They start off by advising to install the software that comes on the included CD, which is supposed to auto-run and walk you through installation.  It doesn't...I tried two different PCs - one running Win7 and one running XP.  The disk wouldn't run on either.  I opened the disk tried double-clicking on the installer as well as other included applications, and each time I got an error message that said "this is not a valid Win32 application," even though it had a .exe extension.I finally gave up on the CD, and did a google search to see if I could download the software. The one program you really need is "Search IP Camera," and I was actually able to download it from the EasyN website. (It's a .rar archive, so you'll have to have a program like WinZip to unpack it.)The downloaded version worked just fine.  But bear in mind - getting this software is just the beginning in a fairly involved process.There is no excuse for shipping an installer disk with errors, and there's no reason it should take a degree in computer science to install a freakin' webcam! I probably should have given this thing 2 stars, but like I said, I was pretty happy with it, once I finally got it going.

Reviews.Title: spy like us
Reviews.Author: Joseph Donnelly
Reviews.Content: Great product.  I can be anywhere in the world be connected to the internet and see what is happening in my shop.  Great piece of hardware.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic and simple to use. Washed out colors though.
Reviews.Author: Christopher!!!!
Reviews.Content: Camera works beautifully. Of the three I own currently, none of them have very true to life colors. They are fairly washed out, no matter what settings I choose.The camera came set up taking an IP address, but was already set on a random port. I had to use the included software to find out what port it decided to hang out on.After finding the cameras (which the software did in a matter of seconds) I was able to get them working in Blue Iris extremely quickly.  The Auto Detect function when adding a camera, set these to work as if they were Foscam Brand.The Pan/Tilt speed adjustment is fantastic. These cameras have a super fast pan/tilt speed available. All the way down to slow as molasses.I haven't had a single trouble with them. When connected wired to my switch, I am getting a great framerate and have not had any disconnect issues. On Wifi and right on the edge of my routers range, they aren't as quick and responsive, but still work great. Getting typically 6-15 FPS on wifi.

Reviews.Title: Quick, Simple, Easy
Reviews.Author: DannyC
Reviews.Content: Simple and easy to use.  I like the celerity and ease of setting up.  You can see in low light from anywhere you have Internet connection.  I chose this cam because of the low price.  I would say it's a great ipcam for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very bad product, died in just 2 weeks.
Reviews.Author: Jose Villalba
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 pcs of this very bad camera. Has horrible color, very bad video quality and sound. Off course, has a good price but one of the cameras has died in just 2 weeks, no electric problem, no water problem, nothing, just died. The other camera has died when I stoped my car and the camera just fly a little and died before.

Reviews.Title: No software support
Reviews.Author: Rod D. Sherwin
Reviews.Content: You better like the firmware that you get with the camera because it is the last one you will get.  If you attempt to go through their circuitous journey to upgrade the firmware it ultimately takes you to the Foscam site with no cross reference to the firmware that you might need.  Guess wrong, as I must have, and you now own a paperweight.In other words, EasyN does not support this camera.  I now own a brick.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Dario Chaney
Reviews.Content: still having a difficult time connecting away from home when not connected to wi fi. other than that the camera is great!

Reviews.Title: It's a good camera for this price.
Reviews.Author: WatchLover "110260"
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these. Zero problem so far. Easy setup since my router supports UPnP (auto port forwarding support), so basically connect the camera via a cable first, change the port, enter the wireless network info, reboot the camera and disconnect the cable. Wala! The little label at the bottom of the camera is very important, you should use the ddns name after network setup is completed. I agree that better instructions will help, so it gets 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: this is crap
Reviews.Author: Donald Jefferson
Reviews.Content: software sucks, mostly in Asain.  Only holding on this because I have no other cameras.  Has a blinking light in the front that says come here I am recording.  I have got more use out of the fake cameras

Reviews.Title: Ultimate Review - A MUST READ!!!
Reviews.Author: Happy C "I love Amazon!"
Reviews.Content: Who am I?I never installed an IP Camera until I bought a Wansview, Foscam, and EasyN. I did at least 5 hours of research, reading each camera's reviews, decided to buy all 3 and try all 3. All the same product, different operating systems, slightly different hardware. I returned everything else and kept the EasyN. The first camera took me 3 hours to install. I ordered 3 more EasyN FS613s and installed all 3 of them, simultaneously, using a MAC, within 20 minutes.Bottom Line:This is the cheapest IP Camera on the market. It is incredibly durable and reliable for just remote controlled viewing on your iPhone. Don't expect amazing customer service and well written manuals. If you're a beginner and planning to buy this, do not expect an easy install unless you have a friend who has done it before or a reliable forum to ask questions and receive answers. The product itself is good, its amazing for the price, but the infrastructure behind it...is almost non existent.Cons:Installation:Installation Manual is useless. If you are a beginner, refer to forums and ask around. DO NOT just start hacking/typing/editing away. You will lock yourself outta the camera, force a factory reset, and eventually refer to the forums, save yourself time, start by reading the forums.Installation is built for Windows. Mac is completely possible. I did it. You cannot just follow directions and get this installed, it will be so frustrating. You have to conceptually understand how an IP Camera works. Then you'll be able to easily install.Audio:There is Wi-Fi and Power Supply Interference on the audio. You cannot use this as a baby monitor unless you make some modifications (solder, external microphone).iPhone App:I PAID $2.99 for IP Cam Viewer, otherwise all the other FREE apps, do not provide audio. Internet Explorer/Mozilla/Chrome/ANY Mac App camera viewer will not provide AUDIO. I have searched high and low, and the only way to get audio is a 3rd party PAID iPhone App or using a Windows system and installing EasyN's camera program.Pros:Extremely durable. I've dropped the camera, my kid has put his mouth all over it, he's twisted the camera and it still manages to fix itself if you move it back into 'reset position'Can add up to 64 cameras. I use 4 throughout my house. Its beautiful.

Reviews.Title: aay
Reviews.Author: antonio sy
Reviews.Content: I like this product because it is less expensive compare to other product but they have same features with other expensive brand.  it is also easy to install. but is one thing I do not know if I can install it on my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price.......
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: I bought this to setup security in my home..... the price was good......but unless you are an IT person, this could be time consuming in setting up...... you have to connect using the supplied cable to your router or computer for the initial installation including setting up wireless....... the cd software for watching are recording did not work for me but I was able to find other free softwares for doing that.... one is called iSpy....once I got it all figured out, the cam works great with panning and zoom....and the night vision is awesome......... now I will do the port forwarding for watching the cam on the internet with my phone or computer while I'm away....

Reviews.Title: Anything but Easy
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I have two identical cameras from Wanscam and was able to get them up and running.  Not even my IT son in law can get this one up and running.  You need to hire some translators with technical knowledge to write your software and operating instructions.  It would help you avoid reviews like this.

Reviews.Title: A Good Deal, but it's still a $40 camera...
Reviews.Author: mom2berti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use as a nursery camera. We used to have a dedicated video monitor, but it died, and we thought it might be nice to be able to use our tablet/ipad/phones as monitoring devices.The camera came quickly, and looks exactly like the picture. It feels like cheap plastic, but it does not feel like it's going to fall apart.Setup was a bear. Part of the issue was my fault; I tried to rename the camera hosting setup and that caused all kinds of issues. Once I stopped trying to be creative things got easier. PLEASE NOTE: You have to open a port in your firewall to access the camera via wifi. I've used other IP cameras before that did not require this step; I'm assuming the extra step has something to do with the pan/tilt controls. It took about 2 hours to setup. Now that I know what I'm doing (thanks, YouTube) I would guess that the next one will take me about 20 minutes.And there will be a next one. I am happy with this product, and I am going to order 2 or 3 more this week to use around the house.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but....
Reviews.Author: Louman
Reviews.Content: The camera works nicely connected to my router but it has been very difficult to set up for remote viewing off site. Several reviewers left details to make setting up port forwarding easier to remote view but more than a month later, I am still struggling with it. The instructions that are included are very sparse and look to have been translated from chinese. the software is ok but again, not that easy to use. If you have no experience with one of these cameras and want to buy this one, be sure to read the other reviews for some help setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the price.
Reviews.Author: M. STARK
Reviews.Content: The directions that come with this are garbage.  I have a good working knowledge of networking protocols, so getting this up and running took me only about 10 min.  I have 2 Foscam FI8918W cameras that are twice the cost, and the image does not appear to be that much sharper that the image on these.The setup is straight forward, however, I bought two and on the second one I did not use the program to find and alter the camera.  It is set to work as a DHCP client.  All you have to do is to plug the camera up to your router, plug in power, then after a min or so it will show up in your DHCP client list on your router's setup page.  Type that address in, and it is set to port 81.  So an example would be 192.168.0.18:81.  The username is admin with no password.  You can log directly into the camera and then change your settings.Port forwarding and virtual servers are where I see the most complaints on reviews. IT IS NOT THE CAMERA'S FAULT that folks don't understand how to do this.  It takes a little time to understand how it works, and why, but if you do, no camera such as this will be a problem to set up.I have two of these cameras, 2 Foscam FI8918W cameras, and one webcam attached to a pc running Blue Iris and everything works like a charm.Again, GREAT price for this camera, as far as longevity of the product, only time will tell.  Got these last night.

Reviews.Title: Not to bad
Reviews.Author: Matthew Nelson "Matthew Nelson"
Reviews.Content: for the price this isnt to bad of a product. the image quality wasn't to bad. setup took about 30mins the instructions was mostly in chinese. but there was enought english and photos to figure it out. took about another 10mins to get the wifi to work correctly but over all not bad. im thinking about getting another one.

Reviews.Title: This is my 9th one!!!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Nagamura
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this ip camera.  This is the best I can find on market...  I bought easyN ip cameras after I had  tried many other brands.  I really hate myself that I did not just bought this at the first time.  This is the only one that is really fully functioned.  I bought 9 of them so far and put them every where.  My wife said I am crazy.  Yes, I my crazy for these ip cameras!

Reviews.Title: EasyN FS-613B-M166
Reviews.Author: saad alruwaished
Reviews.Content: The camera has excellent quality and the pan features make it a high value for the dollar. I am disappointed in the iphone/ipad software. It does't seem to get the camera to load at all. I have tried it both with 3G and with a local wifi connection and the software still doesn't work. I don't have any problems viewing security cameras through commercial services on my iphone or ipad.

Reviews.Title: need easier directions on how to hook up on the internet.
Reviews.Author: dewone
Reviews.Content: I'm having a extremely horrible time getting this to connect to wear I can access it any where at any time... but everything else was pretty cool to hook up!

Reviews.Title: never worked
Reviews.Author: Tracey Frost Tolman
Reviews.Content: It never worked  in box. Junk. Very hard to install too! I did not have good luck with this product

Reviews.Title: Not for the timid
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "TheMan"
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, like the others, the camera is excellent. Full 640 x 480, in color during day and B/W at night. When I say night, I tested it with zero light and still got a good picture for 30 ft. Having said that, it is a good bargain at the price. Now for the semi bad news; The software it comes with is 1. Hard to set up and 2. Way out of date. It needs to be replaced. The instructions are not there unless you read the fine print ( biggest gotcha is admin/ (no password) for software and then it can be setup but don't expect to use the internet broadcast as it does not work. Fortunately I was able to use the great Webcam7 and Ehe camera to get what I wanted. (Both are free.) Active X controls are not used anymore for controls due to their vulnerabilities and this should be a lot more secure than having to dial Hong Kong for an internet server. I highly recommend this camera for a intranet or home surveillance setup but use other software if you want to send to a  phone or internet computer.  The camera works best with a static IP address.

Reviews.Title: Works well, easy to setup.
Reviews.Author: Wade Colborne
Reviews.Content: I have used 2 of these for a couple weeks now, was very surprised how well they work in the dark.very good especially considering how inexpensive they are.

Reviews.Title: Wireless problematic
Reviews.Author: jjrowan
Reviews.Content: Price seemed good but wireless performance unacceptable.  Configured with Ethernet, selected SSID, security key and static IP address.  Rebooted, disconnected Ethernet during boot, was able to connect to camera wirelessly but panning or tilting often unresponsive.  Disconnected power, moved to within 6 feet of access point, plugged in but camera never came up on network.  After 10 minutes moved camera to work space, connected Ethernet, checked configuration.  Static IP address in place but camera's radio did NOT see any access points.  I have four access points supporting 802.11g and there are 5 others in the area.  Cycling power to the camera a few times, waiting 3 minutes each time, it could not find a single access point.  Checked antenna was properly installed, it was.  Reset to factory defaults, now camera saw access points ! ????  Selected access point, static IP address saved.  Moved camera to desired location, booted and connected.  Throughput still bad via wireless (wired was fine), pan and tilt requests often failed.  I have two Wansview similar and neither have this kind of problem.  Ended up returning for refund.  If you can connect via Ethernet it works fine, wasn't an option for me.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera for the price, but not for wireless
Reviews.Author: P. Sengstock "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I got three of these with the hopes of being able to set up a cheap monitoring system at home.  The interface for the cameras is pretty clunky, but I didn't expect much more for what they cost.  I found them to be most reliable when using a static IP instead of DHCP.  Testing them over ethernet worked great, but when I transitioned them all to wireless (802.11g), they were spotty at best.The wireless router they were connected to was a brand new Netgear R7000, and there weren't any issues at that end.  When testing the connection and pings over ethernet, I couldn't find any faults with the cameras.  They really worked great.  The only thing that would have made them better in that configuration is if they also supported PoE.  When testing pings to each camera over the wireless, there was a LOT of latency and dropped packets.  If the cameras were in close proximity to the wireless router and had little to no object interference, the pings were very consistent, and they would rarely drop any packets.  I moved one camera to another room, and it started dropping packets like crazy.  Connecting this same camera to a wireless bridge in that room eliminated the dropped packets.  This suggests that the wireless transmitters in these cameras just aren't up to today's standards.  One regular drywall wall shouldn't be enough to kill 802.11g.Things got even worse when I attempted to pull video from the cameras wirelessly.  Over ethernet, I could max out the resolution and frame rate on each camera.  Over wireless, I got spotty results running at half resolution and 10fps.  After a while, the each camera would eventually drop off the network.  Sometimes they would come back on their own, but most times they needed to be reset manually.  I noticed that the individual ping times to each camera would gradually build and build as soon as you started streaming video from them.  We're talking pings of up to 1600ms before the cameras dropped off the network.  The frequency of dropped packets also increased after starting the video feed.  Again, it seems like the wireless transmitters just aren't up to snuff, because I had no issues running these cameras over ethernet.I was very hopeful for these cameras due to the feature set (it even seems like there are custom CGI commands that you can run) and the overall cost.  Because these were purchased specifically for wireless use, and that was the one way in which they could not perform, I had to return them.  If you're looking for a cheap cheap cheap WIRED pan/tilt camera solution, then these will probably work fine.  If wireless is a requirement, look for something else.If you do want to use these (or any IP camera, really), I strongly suggest you look into a free product called iSpy (www.ispyconnect.com).  Even these EasyN cameras were able to configured and controlled from that software, as well as many other pro, mid, and cheapo brands.

Reviews.Title: like other reviewers sead, setup is key
Reviews.Author: Dan the handy man
Reviews.Content: for the price, it cant be beat. After some time setting it up, I got every feature to work. WIFI connection is stable, but its always better to use the wired connection. Remember its only a 0.3 mega pixel camera, this in a way is good because you can set up a dozen  cameras on one network without the worry of using up all your bandwidth. The downside is you can't see to far. Inside short range view is perfect for this camera.

Reviews.Title: First one didn't work - second one is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Condra
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - This is the second unit I bought. The first one, I just couldn't get it to work with my WiFi network. After about 3 hours, I gave up and swapped it for another one. This one worked like a charm and has been working perfectly for about a month. I do not use the DYNDNS built in, since I have my router setup to use DYNDNS already. I just mapped the pre-configured port (81) on my router, and it was visible to the Internet. Don't forget to setup your user accounts, or anyone can get in! I also downloaded the app from the Play Store and it works all the time, even though the arrows are backward and the buttons are in Chinese (I think?). Overall, this guy meets and exceeds my needs, and I'd buy another in a second!

Reviews.Title: It works but no wifi.
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Evans
Reviews.Content: It would not stay connected with wifi for more than a few seconds.  Other than that I like it!  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Difficult Setup
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Very limited information in the instruction manual.  Poor translation grammar, need fair amount of network setup experience to get it to work. (Still haven't been able to communicate with it via internet).  Online directions are not much better that the supplied manual and will intermittently change to Chinese Language.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: dimov
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, this is what I expected, everything works korektno.Zdraveyte all, that's what I expected, everything works korektno.Zdraveyte all, that's what I expected, everything works correctly.

Reviews.Title: Question ?
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Does anyone know if this camera actually records motion video or just takes still shot images.I want a camera that can record and not just take Pic's to send to my Phone ..

Reviews.Title: OK overall
Reviews.Author: Babydoc15
Reviews.Content: It was extremely difficult to get connect and view from a different location. But once you finally get it connected, it works great. Just too much upfront work

Reviews.Title: Works better than expected
Reviews.Author: Bandon Streitmatter
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well as a use for a baby monitor. I get a very clear picture in a pitch dark room, and the audio works well enough to use as a two way communicator from my basement to my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: EasyN IP camera.
Reviews.Author: Robert Johnson
Reviews.Content: I do have computer and networking experience.  This was easy to set.  From opening to installed was 15 minutes.  Web and mobile works fine when going through a browser. There are apps out there but the web interface works for me.  I would like to try a few different kind of cameras but I think this is a nice cheap solution.Cons:  Directions are horrible for non IT people.  BUT someone did put directions on here that are super easy to follow.Pros:  It is cheap at 50$.  It works with a bit of knowledge.

Reviews.Title: ip cam
Reviews.Author: matts
Reviews.Content: Allows security viewing access while on your home wifi.  Having a hard time port forwarding to be able to view via the web.  Instructions are a little hard to follow,  and android  program for viewing is in Chinese.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: doriedm
Reviews.Content: practiced camera to monitor your baby, from any of your devices, such as your computer or phone. provides sharp images and works in real time

Reviews.Title: the producto works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Darwin Campoverde
Reviews.Content: camera instalation requieres some technical experiencesoftware interface and colors could be betteri use this for watching my baby girl

Reviews.Title: Great wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Dennis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to test to see if it would integrate with my alarm system.  It has the connections to allow monitoring and seems to work well.  It is a little hard to use the embedded software but once you learn how to setup it work ok.  The motion is sensitive to light changes so if you put this in a room with windows make sure the curtains are closed.  Email and remote controls are great.  I use it when I travel to check on the house and move it to look around when I am not there.  Good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: ip camera was pretty easy to use
Reviews.Author: Nathan Helgerson
Reviews.Content: i set up the ip camera quickly after I learned how to use it and how it worked with my computer.  it seems like the stronger your internet connection the better it works.  the apps for these cameras are lackluster but it is great to watch your pets or your kids at home if you are away.

Reviews.Title: EasyN does work
Reviews.Author: Theron in Florida
Reviews.Content: After 4 1/2 hours, with a short lunch break it works great using a Linksys WRT54G router and with the pesty green light NOT blinking. It does work wireless and from anywhere in the world using wifi. Reviews on Amazon and YouTube were very useful. Also having a wireless mini laptop computer and iPad helped. Have not set it and may not set for sending emails. There has to be a easier way to skin this cat.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAM BUT ITS LIKE A LOTTERY
Reviews.Author: Chaz Souder
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras. One of them works pretty good but the other boots randomly and takes forever to start working again. I sent an email to EasyN support and they answered very quickly. At first, the girl said that I should perform a soft reset but since it didnt solve the problem, she said there was nothing else to do since the current version of the firmware in the camera was the newest. The girl sent me the firmware file so I could reflash the cam (thinking maybe a corrupt firmware), but the firmware utility says the file is invalid. So, I ended up with one functional camera out of two I actually bought. I would return it to get my money back or a new replacement camera, but unfortunately I live in South America and the costs of doing this would exceed what I would get in exchange. Advice: buy this only if you live in the States or anywhere you can return this item.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: trektrek
Reviews.Content: a lot of flexibility with tilt and pan, a little noise and it requires a wired power supply. when are the long life or rechargeable battery operated models coming out ?

Reviews.Title: Good camera hard to figure out if you not a IT guy
Reviews.Author: shanee86
Reviews.Content: Its a nice camera the manual sucks and so does software pretty much. Good thing I do IT stuff so I could figure it out after I bought this I realized how hard they are to setup so made a site to make it easier on other my site is http://ipcamguide.com all about how to set these things up.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Elong
Reviews.Content: Setup wasn't too bad with the included CD, a breeze for tech geeks like me.  Video quality is pretty good.  I'd recommend either the Foscam App or another 3rd Party App for access on Android Devices.  Web interface doesn't have mic/speaker options without ActiveX controls.  Night vision is decent.  Mic picks up a lot of distortion, otherwise I'd give it 5 stars.  For the price I can't complain and may actually buy another one.  Got this one for use as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Salts "Saltslug6"
Reviews.Content: Has great picture and is pretty easy to set up. I use mine just with my Ipad/IPhone. Plug it in use their Find Camera software and enter in an IP address for it. use the free App Fing to check your available IP address. After that is set go to the tab that says more on the camera finder and hit set up wifi. Log into your router by entering its IP address in the top of your Internet browser and log in. The user name and password are located on your router. Once logged in for Verizon users your Internet IP address is is on the left you will need that to enter into the camera viewing app. Hit the menus bar at the top that says my network. Find your camera a d hit the selection to the left that says port forwarding and your camera should show up in that list. Get the port number. Their apps aren't any good so use something like live cams pro. It's only a couple of dollars I think and can be viewed on Wifi and 3G. Just set your camera up on your private favorites. Enter the Internet ip, camera port, then admin and password which are those two words unless you changed them and you should be done. Audio and mic can be accessed through this app

Reviews.Title: Good product, bad manual, need some basic internet skill to setup
Reviews.Author: maxima
Reviews.Content: This is the first wireless camera I bought.I spent a total of ~2.5 hours (including reading online helps) to get it fully functional. As mentioned in many reviews, their manual is junk. Just Google "easyN IP camera" and there are few reviews (here at Amazon and other websites) with very detailed instructions, from getting it to run with a wire first, setting Wifi, setting internet access, to smart phone access.I'm not a computer/internet guru, but I have some knowledge of IP/port/setting up wireless router/port forwarding, etc. If you are not familiar with any of these words, getting a friend who is to help would be a good idea.After the camera is up and running, I have no more complains. Picture quality is good, control is easy, extra setups (after you complete the basics including Wifi, external Internet access) are easy. Very satisfied. Yes their iPhone app is another piece of junk, but I don't really care :)

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: jorge salazar
Reviews.Content: I have purchase several of these, they work fine at night, they are a bit difficult to set up but once that is resolved, they work great. I have 6 installed in my offices and I can always see whats going on, resolution is fine and night view is more than suitable for making sure everything is alright.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great - software is poor
Reviews.Author: Mr Chris
Reviews.Content: A real fiddle to set up to view over the net - it took me a few hours and I'm reasonably competent. Instructions are useless.Once up and running though - I'm very pleased - the cameras are great, just let down by gruesome software and set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Camera works excellent I have this camera and I have had no problems with it. Novice users might have trouble setting remote viewing from smartphone. I recommend this camera to intermediate users it has every feature you could want.

Reviews.Title: Nice option as a remote security camera
Reviews.Author: Larns
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading a bunch of the reviews, and I'm glad I did - the camera works almost exactly like I need it to - as a remote security camera.I have it hooked up at my "summer cottage".  It is configured to send me photos embedded within an email whenever it detects "motion", and it does a fine job at that.  It is connected through my wireless router over 802.11g (WPA-PSK/AES)... and that all works reliably.It is easy to get it to work remotely (over the internet) if you know the basics of topics like DDNS and TCP port forwarding through your home router.  If you don't understand these concepts, you might struggle a bit as many here seem to have done.  But the short of it is that yes, it can be driven over the internet, and it works fairly well - but the devil is in the details - or, should I say, in your home network configuration.The web user interface isn't very pretty, but it is functional and reliable... and with only a few grammar errors :-)  Like a lot of low-end devices, the software isn't easy to use, but one can easily figure it out with some knowledge and experimentation.The camera is 640x480 - which is completely adequate for my use, but it is far from being as good as your 2001-vintage digital camera.  The colors are particularly lousy, so don't expect too much.  The IR lamps really light up a room in the dark - they are quite capable.I can't get audio to work at all, but since that isn't my goal I haven't tried very hard.- Four stars for being a decent home security cam: good mechanicals, price, and reliability.- One star lost for mediocre software and my inability to get audio working.- Hopefully a software update will allow it to gain a full five stars!

Reviews.Title: Close but no cigar! But hold on...
Reviews.Author: bobazon
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd and the least expensive IP camera I've tried.  EasyN could make this a real winner if they would simply provide quality setup instructions and offer an app for iPad.  I drove myself nuts trying to figure out setup for Internet access.  Thanks to some great help on youTube, I figured it out.Come on EasyN, you've got a great opportunity here......now follow through.Would I purchase more of them? Absolutely, now that I figured it out!UPDATE: I've had this in service for a little over month now.  I give at least one thumb up.  It emails four photos when it sees action.  It isn't perfect, but it is mighty close for $50 bucks.  I hope EasyN works on this and brings us the real deal soon.  I still recommend it for the money, but you better have some network savvy to get it up and running.

Reviews.Title: At least it's a camera.
Reviews.Author: J. York
Reviews.Content: The video it takes is good enough, and is dead silent as it pans and tilts. Web controls on a phone are poor, but there are many applications that can control it. Installation is simple if you understand that the CD has a setup utility.The two way communication is only not an outright lie because it does have a microphone and a speaker. But unless you are willing to use Morse code to communicate with bursts of static, you will be disappointed. Microphone doesn't pick up anything farther than 4 feet away, unless you have a refrigerator within about 15 feet, in which case it picks the droning up perfectly well -- to the exclusion of everything else. Even within the 4 feet it's a garbled mess on the other side. I had my wife talking directly and loudly into the microphone and I couldn't understand anything she said.The built in speaker is even worse; at least I can plug in an external speaker, which I assume would fix that problem. Unfortunately that's not as important because I'm not interested in having a one-way "big brother" lecture at someone standing near my security camera.

Reviews.Title: ip camera
Reviews.Author: michael ray groves
Reviews.Content: i love this camera, its very nice and gives me a secure feeling being able to look at what is going on at my house , when im not there

Reviews.Title: I almost love it!
Reviews.Author: Lomak
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because my grandson sleeps in the front bedroom and he has 4 windows in his room he is only 3 yrs old so for my peace of mind I set it up in his room, the night vision is awesome you can see everything in the dark, you can hear what is going on in the room and you can move the camera with your android phone or the computer, but, I can't give it 5 stars because the instructions are not easy to follow it takes alot of time to figure things out I finally gave up trying to get the wireless part to work so I hooked it up directly to the router with an ethernet cord it works great! Now if I can try my patience again I'll see if I can get the thing to record

Reviews.Title: Good but how do i view it online
Reviews.Author: mic
Reviews.Content: Its a very good webcam but i cant seem to access it from the internet only while on my network.

Reviews.Title: great for home use.
Reviews.Author: Alex S. Deoliveira "XPINDULA"
Reviews.Content: easy to instal, i never had contact with anything like that and didn't take much work for me to instal, i connected to my network wirelessly without much trouble. i recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara y a un bajo precio ........ Ecelent cam & a very low price
Reviews.Author: Cleomaris C. Sanchez V
Reviews.Content: t's very good camera, but the software can handle all functions.I could not activate the moment bi-directional sound. But the image and the rotation is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Seems OK so far
Reviews.Author: John Rogers "JR"
Reviews.Content: Bang for the buck.  Seems OK so far.  Must have taken me 10 minutes to get it set up and running.  Does everything that it says it does and the price is great.  Get the instructions from the web site so you don't go blind trying to read the sheet in the box.  I now have 3 different brands and all seem pretty good.  Good value - now to see how long it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to test and enjoy the camera before giving my review. It is a great item to purchase. It does everything it says that it would do. Setting up is not as easy if you are not computer or network savyy.  I plan on purchasing a few more for the house.  I would give it a full 5 stars but the instructions are not as easy as it could have been.

Reviews.Title: Worked for us.
Reviews.Author: M. Morales
Reviews.Content: Used these before and bought three more for a relatives house.  Please see my review on this product:Wansview Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision/ Internet Surveillance Camera Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring supportThese are basically a slight newer version of the same camera.  All my comments, etc... still apply.

Reviews.Title: OK but not great
Reviews.Author: Frederick G. Myers
Reviews.Content: This was my second purchase of this "type" of camera from Amazon.  In both instances I did not get the exact model that I ordered, but a reasonable alternative.  In general, it works about as well as you would expect a $50 IP camera to work: OK, but not great.  The first camera was superior to the second (both by the same mfgr.)  The second camera was not quite in focus, its colors were less realistic and pan/tilt commands were very rough.  The instructions could use a major rewrite by an english-speaking person.  My best advice is visit the manufacturer's website and read the forums.  WARNING: You had better understand port-forwarding if you plan to access this camera from outside your local LAN.  It is different and the terminology is different from one manufacturer to another.As of now I have no need of an additional camera.  If I did, I would probably buy the same product.  A few things, such as the recording mode do not work and are not addressed in the full manual.  But as I said, at $50 it is OK.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Cam - Not hard to use
Reviews.Author: Louis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product due to the impressive feature list. I read a handful of reviews about it being hard to setup so I was skeptical, since I am an IT engineer I figured I'd be able to anyway.I have to say, it is not at all hard to set up, in fact it's really simple.  Easier than a normal router and that says alot.To set it up, connect it via LAN (it must be wired for setup, wireless works later).  Once connected, insert the CD they provided which runs on windows and goto IP Camera Detection -> Advanced.  It will give you the IP of the Camera.  It is on port 81 so it will be [...] for example.Once there you can configure it.  I love it, great feature set.Pros-Great mounting hardware, can be mounted on wall or ceiling-Good IE and Chrome software-Works on iPhone (I recommend you download an ip camera software though, the stock display is crappy)-Has 2 way Mic-Can email motion alerts direct, worked with my gmail account using encryption - awesome-Does not false detect motion-Wireless antenna works well-Rotation is smooth-Outstanding night vision, uses IR leds which are not visible so it produces no visible light yet the camera output looks as if it were broad daylightCons-Built in software only allows mic control from Internet Explorer, for anything over IE 8 make sure to turn on compatability control or it crashes IE-Built in iPhone browser is poor.  Download IpCamera Pro from App Store, with that you can control mic, pan tilt, etc from the iPhone in real time, works amazing with this camera.Overall: HIGHLY recommended.  Setup is easy, features are great, it works outstanding.  For the price you cannot beat this.  I have it outside in a covered environment but it does get moist and it does not hurt it.  I do not think this is water proof so do not put it in direct rain.P.S. This is just as good or better than Foscam models and costs half the price FYI.----------------UPDATE: It has been about a year and this thing is still going strong! Can be controlled with reecam, a free app from the maker on iPhone.  Love this thing.  I have it mounted outside in warm, tropical, rainy conditions.  It is not in direct water/rain and I would not suggest you do, it's on my semi-covered porch.  No issue at all, no wear, no problem, no foggy lens, etc.  I would highly recommend this product.  It can send automated alerts to GMAIL.  if you download the iphone gmail app - it will push notify you.  I made a custom acct for cam alerts so I get push alerts with screen captures on my iphone when it detects motion.  Awesome solution.

Reviews.Title: Mr.
Reviews.Author: opeynuts
Reviews.Content: Ok, contrary to popular belief you can set this up completely on a mac.  Their is no support and/or instructions.  However it can be done with a little know how and figuring out that the default port number is "81"  Most of the instructions from other users is great but you need this last piece of info to install entirely on a mac.  First, use your router to determine what ip is being assigned to the camera (wired).  I did this by looking at current ip addresses in use and then plug in the camera and see which new ip appears.  Once you have that download "firefox" for mac.  Use that browser and type the ip address plus port 81.  (10.0.0.15:81 example) Then walk through the set up like you can read in several detailed descriptions in the review section.4 Stars cause the instructions do not help and are useless!Know your network before you buy!Good Luck

Reviews.Title: functional but has a few bugs
Reviews.Author: Love Wireless "Chris"
Reviews.Content: has wireless link and can email 5 successive images on motion alert.  I use Gmail and the options on it was easy to setup.  There are many problems with the documentation and user manual but some Google searches fixes that up.  The Dyn DNS instructions are too confusing so I used another free service and point it to my own router with a port forward to the IPCAM.One big problem on this is the schedule alert uses a small table for user to click the time blocks and that is just awfully difficult to use.  When the schedule arrive at the "turn on" time, it always false alarms and snaps some pics.  So everyday I would get email right at the turn on time.The price is cheap and it provides a pretty good option for home security, even a baby monitor!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product! Sofware Could improve.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: The product is really excellent.The camera works like a charm, and even the packaging is good (this is important as well).The android app is crApp!. Doesn't even recognize the camera (unless you use the local IP).The software (web application) to administrate the camera is not bad, but it could be improved.Here's a step to step conceptual guide to configure the camera (it's difficult with the manual).1) After plugging the camera to the power supply, connect the LAN (grey) cable to your router.  Go to your favorite browser and type 192.168.1.126:81 (this is port 81)  user: admin, password empty.2) Configure the wireless connection (from now on, you won't need the lan cable anymore).  Configure all other things like user and password, alerts, FTP upload, email settings (not really needed at this point, but useful to have),3) HOW TO ACCESS FROM THE INTERNETYou probably have a dynamic IP, and this causes problems of access when it changes.For this reason you need to configure a Dynamic DNS hostname (DDNS). This is an online service (free or paid) you can get and configure in the camera options.I use [...]/ (that I can configure from the router directly)Then, you will need to configure your router's PORT FORWARDING, pointing any port of your choice (which will be set in the dynamic DNS) to port 81.Once configured, you can access, for example, mycamera.dyndns.org from anywhere and it will redirect you to your computer's updated IP.4)Mobile APP (phone, tablet)I have purchased an APP called IPCam viewer pro, from google play store, for $5.It has all I need to view and manage the camera and activate/deactivate the motion detection feature.I'm happy with it, and it fulfills its purpose.Remember this is a conceptual guide and you will have to google for more info. Just pay attention to the concepts.

Reviews.Title: Quite good bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Paid around $56 with 2day shipping. Good quality for the price (its only vga but what you expected), very good IR capabilities (works fine on small rooms). Setting it up was quite straight forward, but i would not recomend it to somebody that has no networking and wifi experience. Instructions that came with unit are relatively well translated from chinese i assume, so they might too cause problems.Build quality is very good, wifi reception is so so, but that can be fixed with better positioning or better antenna. Sound quality (both microphone and speaker output) is reasonable.So this is not best of the best, but for the price, its nearly perfect. I have recomended this to couple of people as a simple surveilance/babymonitor. Works perfectly with tablets and smartphones (Android platform)

Reviews.Title: Nothing Easy n setting this thing up!!!
Reviews.Author: Joyful
Reviews.Content: The product is great once it is set up. Awesome picture quality, etc... but I literally spent a day and a half fighting to get this camera installed. I had to do so much research to even begin to get it to work, which included reading most of the complete manual and researching everything I could find on networking. Thankful for jammendolia's review that walks you through most of the set up for the camera, but if your network is not already configured just right, you are in for a challenge. If you are not super computer savvy or just glutton for a challenge (like myself), better pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: Works for Me!
Reviews.Author: John D. Geshrick
Reviews.Content: I have accumulated a host of WiFi cams over the passed several years for use in my home for remote monitoring and security.  I have several LinkSys cams that i purchased from eBay ranging in price from $60-$100.  I wish I had purchased 5 of these guys instead of the others.  There are a few little humps you have to get overwhile configuring the cam that are primarily related to language translation issues (Chinese to English) but once I figured that out, this camera is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works with some problems
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Had no problems setting up the IP or the wireless. Dont know why others have problems. After setting it up so it would get its own IP I found that the IP would change after rebooting so I manualy set the IP which works better.The only thing I am having problems with is the motion detection. I can not get it to detect cars and still not give false reports.I have desktop software that would work however when running it it uses up a lot of bandwidth on the wireless.

Reviews.Title: If you do not know what your doing regarding Wireless Routing, then...
Reviews.Author: Wayne Bowden
Reviews.Content: It may take a while to get this camera to work right...  I have 3 of them and a secured network and it took a half a day to finally get the first one, then just copied the config and imported it into the other 2, changed the IP's the the static I set up in my router... Be sure not to use DHCP with it, you have to set it up Static... DDNS takes a little more to set up but once done you can control them from your phone, but the sound diesn't really work well...

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA WHEN FINALLY SET UP
Reviews.Author: Obron "Obron"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up on LAN. WLAN was very difficult.I am handicap and purchased this camera to monitor front door visually and voice before I made the trip to open the door.LAN was up running within 5 minutes of opening box. I tried about every combination of settings on camera and router to no avail. WLAN was up and running on all other wireless devices on my network.I was ready to return it until I found a 2.4GHz 20dBi RP-SMA Yagi Wireless WLAN WiFi Antenna. Ordered it and problem solved. Get a great picture day or night, Voice communication is a bit low but plan to attach an external speaker (it has a speaker jack). About the only complaint now is tilt does not go low enough as mentioned by several others. Camera is very rugged dropped several time during WLAN set up. My wife claims I even threw it a couple times.I would highly recommend this camera. The YAGI antenna was only $8.00.

Reviews.Title: EasyN, easy, simple
Reviews.Author: iMacDSL
